title: Enacts the engineers', architects', landscape architects' and land surveyors' good samaritan act
summary: Enacts the "engineers', architects', landscape architects' and land surveyors' good samaritan act" to protect from liability for personal injury, wrongful death, property damage or other loss professional engineers, architects, landscape architects and land surveyors who render voluntary services, without compensation, at the scene of a natural disaster or catastrophe.

       Introduced  by  M.  of  A.  ENGLEBRIGHT -- read once and referred to the
         Committee on Higher Education

       AN ACT to amend the executive law, in relation to  enacting  the  "engi-
         neers',  architects',  landscape  architects' and land surveyors' good
         samaritan act"

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  The executive law is amended by adding a new section 29-f
    2  to read as follows:
    3    S  29-F.  ENGINEERS',  ARCHITECTS',  LANDSCAPE  ARCHITECTS'  AND  LAND
    4  SURVEYORS' GOOD SAMARITAN ACT. 1. AS USED IN THIS SECTION:
    5    (A)  "PROFESSIONAL  ENGINEER"  SHALL MEAN A PERSON DULY LICENSED UNDER
    6  THE EDUCATION LAW AS A PROFESSIONAL ENGINEER.
    7    (B) "ARCHITECT" SHALL MEAN A PERSON DULY LICENSED UNDER THE  EDUCATION
    8  LAW AS AN ARCHITECT.
    9    (C)  "LANDSCAPE ARCHITECT" SHALL MEAN A PERSON DULY LICENSED UNDER THE
   10  EDUCATION LAW AS A LANDSCAPE ARCHITECT.
   11    (D) "LAND SURVEYOR" SHALL MEAN A PERSON DULY LICENSED UNDER THE EDUCA-
   12  TION LAW AS A PROFESSIONAL LAND SURVEYOR.
   13    (E) "PUBLIC OFFICIAL" SHALL MEAN ANY FEDERAL, STATE OR LOCALLY ELECTED
   14  OFFICIAL WITH OVERALL EXECUTIVE RESPONSIBILITY IN  THE  JURISDICTION  IN
   15  WHICH THE EMERGENCY OR EVENT HAS OCCURRED.
   16    (F)  "PUBLIC  SAFETY  OFFICIAL"  SHALL  MEAN  ANY APPOINTED OR ELECTED
   17  FEDERAL, STATE OR LOCAL OFFICIAL WITH OVERALL  EXECUTIVE  RESPONSIBILITY
   18  TO  COORDINATE  PUBLIC SAFETY IN THE JURISDICTION IN WHICH THE EMERGENCY
   19  OR EVENT HAS OCCURRED.
   20    (G) "LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICIAL" SHALL MEAN  ANY  APPOINTED  OR  ELECTED
   21  FEDERAL,  STATE  OR LOCAL OFFICIAL WITH OVERALL EXECUTIVE RESPONSIBILITY
   22  TO COORDINATE LAW ENFORCEMENT IN THE JURISDICTION IN WHICH THE EMERGENCY
   23  OR EVENT HAS OCCURRED.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD00251-01-1

       A. 3884                             2

    1    (H) "BUILDING INSPECTION OFFICIAL" SHALL MEAN ANY APPOINTED OR ELECTED
    2  FEDERAL, STATE OR LOCAL OFFICIAL WITH OVERALL  EXECUTIVE  RESPONSIBILITY
    3  TO COORDINATE BUILDING INSPECTION IN THE JURISDICTION IN WHICH THE EMER-
    4  GENCY OR EVENT HAS OCCURRED.
    5    2.  A  PROFESSIONAL  ENGINEER,  ARCHITECT, LANDSCAPE ARCHITECT OR LAND
    6  SURVEYOR WHO VOLUNTARILY, WITHOUT COMPENSATION ACTING REASONABLY AND  IN
    7  GOOD  FAITH, PROVIDES STRUCTURAL, ELECTRICAL, MECHANICAL, OR OTHER ENGI-
    8  NEERING,  ARCHITECTURAL,  LANDSCAPE  ARCHITECTURAL  OR  LAND   SURVEYING
    9  SERVICES  AT  THE SCENE OF A DECLARED NATIONAL, STATE OR LOCAL EMERGENCY
   10  CAUSED BY A  MAJOR  EARTHQUAKE,  HURRICANE,  TORNADO,  FIRE,  EXPLOSION,
   11  COLLAPSE, OR OTHER SIMILAR DISASTER OR CATASTROPHIC EVENT AT THE REQUEST
   12  OF A NATIONAL, STATE OR LOCAL PUBLIC OFFICIAL, LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICIAL,
   13  PUBLIC  SAFETY  OFFICIAL  OR  BUILDING  INSPECTION OFFICIAL ACTING IN AN
   14  OFFICIAL CAPACITY, SHALL NOT BE LIABLE FOR ANY PERSONAL INJURY, WRONGFUL
   15  DEATH, PROPERTY DAMAGE OR OTHER LOSS CAUSED BY  THE  PROFESSIONAL  ENGI-
   16  NEER'S,  ARCHITECT'S,  LANDSCAPE  ARCHITECT'S  OR  LAND SURVEYOR'S ACTS,
   17  ERRORS OR OMISSIONS IN THE PERFORMANCE  OF  ANY  ENGINEERING,  ARCHITEC-
   18  TURAL, LANDSCAPE ARCHITECTURAL OR LAND SURVEYING SERVICES FOR ANY STRUC-
   19  TURE,  BUILDING,  PIPING  OR OTHER ENGINEERED SYSTEM, EITHER PUBLICLY OR
   20  PRIVATELY OWNED EXCEPT IN THOSE INSTANCES  WHERE  THE  PERSONAL  INJURY,
   21  WRONGFUL  DEATH,  PROPERTY  DAMAGE  OR  OTHER LOSS RESULTS FROM THE ACT,
   22  ERROR OR OMISSION OF THE  PROFESSIONAL  ENGINEER,  ARCHITECT,  LANDSCAPE
   23  ARCHITECT  OR  LAND SURVEYOR WHO HAS FOUND THAT THE STRUCTURE, BUILDING,
   24  PIPING OR OTHER ENGINEERED SYSTEM IS FIT FOR THE PURPOSES  OF  OCCUPANCY
   25  OR USAGES FOR WHICH IT WAS INTENDED.
   26    (A) THE IMMUNITY PROVIDED IN THIS SECTION SHALL APPLY ONLY TO A VOLUN-
   27  TARY ENGINEERING, ARCHITECTURAL, LANDSCAPE ARCHITECTURAL OR LAND SURVEY-
   28  ING SERVICE THAT OCCURS WITHIN NINETY DAYS OF THE EMERGENCY, DISASTER OR
   29  CATASTROPHIC  EVENT, UNLESS EXTENDED BY AN EXECUTIVE ORDER ISSUED BY THE
   30  GOVERNOR UNDER THE GOVERNOR'S EMERGENCY EXECUTIVE POWERS.
   31    (B) NOTHING IN THIS SECTION SHALL PROVIDE IMMUNITY FOR WANTON, WILLFUL
   32  OR INTENTIONAL MISCONDUCT, OR GROSS NEGLIGENCE.
   33    (C) WHERE A PROFESSIONAL ENGINEER, ARCHITECT, LANDSCAPE  ARCHITECT  OR
   34  LAND  SURVEYOR VOLUNTARILY RENDERS SERVICES AT THE REQUEST OF A STATE OR
   35  LOCAL EMPLOYEE OR OFFICIAL AND WHERE SUCH SERVICES FALL WITHIN THE AMBIT
   36  OF THE IMMUNITY PROVIDED IN THIS SECTION, THE LIABILITY OF THE STATE  OR
   37  LOCALITY,  IF ANY, WHICH REQUESTED THE SERVICES SHALL NOT BE AFFECTED BY
   38  THE PROVISIONS OF THIS SECTION.
   39    S 2. This act shall take effect on the first of January next  succeed-
   40  ing the date on which it shall have become a law.
